i once brought back bed bugs from a friends house. my family wasn’t the most well off people, but i was able to get rid of them simply by using a couple cans of bedbug spray, my moms vacuum, and bucket and some pinesol. peoples first mistake with bedbugs no matter how poor or rich is to freak out and buy a bunch of things that don’t work, and to run away and sleep on the couch. they can follow you, or even cling onto to you ad drop off near other people and spread the problem. what you need to do when you can’t afford to get a heat treatment, is to throw everything on, under, and around you bed in trashbags that youve sprayed the inside of. look over your bed and spray only places you know bed buds are at. then vacuum everywhere. then thoroughly clean everything. bedbugs like dark, damp, and dusty places to hide in. disassemble your bed frame. clean that sucker too. spray in all the places where the parts connect. reassemble it and spray the outside. wipe down your mattress and boxframe. spray it entirely. vacuum and clean your floors, like you’ve got the power of mother licking pinesol! then wash your blankets, taking care to transport them in the trash bags. make sure to keep sleeping in your own bed. i didn’t put sheets or my bedspread back on for a few months. i used thin blankets i could wash on laundry day. spray around the legs of your bed, and around other beds people are sleeping in, in case they move to another room. don’t let pets in your room! i slept in my underwear for weeks like i was putting myself out for a buffet. be sure to spray along the baseboards and behind things. if you have extra money buy a can every few weeks and spray your entire bed. cleaning so thorough that danny tanner flies from his full house in san diego to shake you hand helps a lot.

there’s no problem with a targeted ad for, say, some club that targets college students or some show on hgtv that targets 40-60 something homeowners. that’s just called trying to reach your audience.
